Classical Mechanics
item.description: Principle of Least Action (\(\delta A=0\)) For arbitary function \(A(x,y)\), \(1^{st}\) order changes in \(A(x,y)\) is \[\delta A(x,y)=\frac{\partial A}{\partial x}\delta A+\frac{\partial A}{\partial y}\delta y\] At stationary point, the derivative of \(A\) with repect to \(x_i\) vanishes: \[\frac{\partial A}{\partial x_i}=0\] for all \(x_i\). Then the condition that \(A\) is stationary is \[\delta A=0\] def \[A=\int_{t_1}^{t_2}\mathscr{L}\mathrm{d}t\] where \[\mathscr{L}=\mathscr{L}(q_i,\dot q_i)\] The condiction for a stationary action is \[\delta A=0\] \[ \begin{aligned} \Rightarrow &\int_{t_1}^{t_2}\delta\mathscr{L}\mathrm{d}t=0\\ &=\int_{t_1}^{t_2}(\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial q_i}\delta q_i+\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial \dot q_i}\delta\dot q_i)\mathrm{d}t\\ &=\int_{t_1}^{t_2}\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial q_i}\delta q_i\mathrm{d}t+ \int_{t_1}^{t_2}\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial\dot q_i}\frac{\mathrm{d}\delta q_i}{\mathrm{d}t}\mathrm{d}t\\ &=\int_{t_1}^{t_2}\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial q_i}\mathrm{d}t+\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial\dot q_i}\delta q_i\bigg\rvert_{t_1}^{t_2}-\int_{t_1}^{t_2}\delta q_i\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}\frac{\partial\mathscr{L}}{\partial\dot q_i}\mathrm{d}t \end{aligned} \] \(\delta q_i\) vanished at the ends of the path (\(\delta q_i(t_1)=\delta q_i(t_2)=0\))

item.title: Probability and Statistics
item.description: Comemts: “Statistics is the study of uncertainty.” Fundamental concepts in probability and statistics A sample space \(S\) An event \(A \subseteq S\) Axions (0) \[P(A) \in [0,1]\] (1) \[P(\phi)=0\] \[P(S)=1\] where \(\phi\) is the null event. (2) \[P(\cup_{i=1}^{n} A_i)=\sum_{i=1}^{n}P(A_i)-\sum_{i<j}P(A_i\cap A_j)+\sum_{i<j<k}P(A_i\cap A_j\cap A_k)-\cdots+(-1)^{n+1}P(\cap_{i=1}^{n}A_i)\] where \(P(\cap_{i=1}^{n}A_i)=P(A_1)P(A_2\mid A_1)P(A_3\mid A_1,A_2)\cdots P(A_n\mid A_1,\cdots A_{n-1})\). \(P(A\cap B)=P(A)P(B\mid A)=P(B)P(A\mid B)\) \(\Rightarrow\) (Bayes’ Theorem)\[\frac{P(A\mid B)P(A)}{P(B)}\] if \(P(B)>0\) What is \(P(A\mid B)\)?
